name: **Classic Juicy Hamburgers**
allergenNotes: Cheese contains Dairy; omit for dairy‑free.
Some Worcestershire sauces contain anchovies (Fish). Check label if sensitive.
ingredients: 1 small onion, very finely grated or minced (optional)
4 slices cheddar, American, or Swiss cheese (optional, Dairy)
Ketchup, mustard, mayo, or BBQ sauce
instructions: Place ground beef in a large bowl; add seasonings and optional onion/garlic. Mix gently until just combined.
Divide into 4 equal portions; form patties with a small indentation in the center.
Preheat grill (or skillet) over medium‑high heat.
Cook patties 4–5 minutes on the first side without pressing, then flip and cook 3–4 minutes more for medium doneness.
Add cheese during the last minute if desired. Toast buns cut‑side down until golden.
Assemble burgers with desired toppings and serve hot.
variations: BBQ Burger: Brush patties with BBQ sauce in the last minute of cooking.
Bacon Cheeseburger: Top with crispy bacon.
Mushroom Swiss: Add sautéed mushrooms with Swiss cheese.
Spicy Kick: Mix chopped jalapeños into the beef.
proTips: Use cold meat for better shape retention.
Do not press patties while cooking.

name: **Steak and Baked Potato**
allergenNotes: Use dairy‑free butter/sour cream to avoid Dairy.
ingredients: 2 ribeye or sirloin steaks (8 oz each)
Kosher salt and black pepper, to taste
Butter, sour cream, and chives for topping (Dairy)
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Scrub potatoes, pierce with a fork, rub with olive oil and salt; bake 1 hour or until tender.
Pat steaks dry; season with salt and pepper.
Heat a skillet or grill over high; add 1–2 tbsp olive oil.
Cook steaks 3–4 minutes per side for medium‑rare (adjust to desired doneness).
Serve steaks with baked potatoes topped with butter, sour cream, and chives.
variations: Garlic Herb Steak: Add a pat of garlic butter on top before serving.
Loaded Potatoes: Add shredded cheese, bacon bits, and sliced green onions.
proTips: Bring steaks to room temperature before cooking.
Use a meat thermometer for perfect doneness.
Rest steaks for 5 minutes before slicing.

name: **Homestyle Macaroni and Cheese**
allergenNotes: Use gluten‑free pasta and cornstarch instead of flour to thicken for GF.
instructions: Cook macaroni according to package directions; drain.
Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat; whisk in flour and cook 1 minute.
Gradually whisk in milk; cook, stirring, until thickened.
Stir in cheddar until melted; season with salt and pepper.
Combine cheese sauce with macaroni and serve hot.
variations: Baked Mac: Top with breadcrumbs and bake until golden.
Spicy Mac: Add diced jalapeños or hot sauce.
Three‑Cheese: Use a mix of cheddar, mozzarella, and Parmesan.
proTips: Shred cheese yourself for smoother melting.
Do not boil the sauce after adding cheese to prevent graininess.

name: **Classic Meatloaf**
ingredients: Glaze: 1/2 cup ketchup + 2 tbsp brown sugar + 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar + 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a sheet pan or prep a loaf pan.
Combine breadcrumbs and milk; let sit 5 minutes.
Add eggs, onion, garlic, celery, ketchup, Worcestershire, mustard, salt, pepper, thyme, and parsley; mix to combine.
Add ground beef and gently mix until just combined; shape into a loaf.
Spread half the glaze over the loaf; bake 40 minutes.
Spread remaining glaze; bake another 20–25 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 160°F.
Rest 10 minutes before slicing.
variations: BBQ Meatloaf: Use BBQ sauce instead of ketchup glaze.
Italian‑Style: Add Parmesan and Italian seasoning; use marinara for glaze.
Bacon‑Wrapped: Wrap the loaf with bacon before baking.
proTips: Do not overmix to keep meatloaf tender.

name: **Crispy Southern Fried Chicken**
allergenNotes: Use dairy‑free buttermilk alternative if needed.
instructions: Place chicken pieces in a large bowl; cover with buttermilk and hot sauce. Marinate 4 hours or overnight in the refrigerator.
Mix flour, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper, and cayenne (if using) in a shallow dish.
Heat oil to 350°F (175°C) in a deep fryer or heavy pot.
Remove chicken from marinade; dredge in flour mixture, pressing to coat well.
Fry in batches: 12–15 minutes for white meat or 15–18 minutes for dark meat, until golden and 165°F internal.
Drain on a rack or paper towels before serving.
variations: Spicy Fried Chicken: Add extra cayenne and chili powder to the coating.
Oven‑Fried: Bake coated chicken at 400°F for 40–50 minutes, turning halfway.
proTips: Maintain oil temperature for a crisp crust.
Do not overcrowd the fryer; it drops oil temperature.
Let coated chicken rest 10 minutes before frying for better adhesion.

name: **Chicken Fried Steak**
ingredients: Gravy: 3 tbsp pan drippings + 3 tbsp flour (Wheat/Gluten) + 2 cups milk (Dairy)
instructions: Season steaks with salt and pepper. Dredge in flour mixed with paprika and garlic powder; dip in buttermilk; dredge again in flour.
Fry steaks in hot oil 3–4 minutes per side until golden and cooked through; drain briefly.
For gravy: Whisk flour into pan drippings; cook 1 minute; whisk in milk; simmer until thickened. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve steaks topped with gravy.
variations: Spicy: Add cayenne pepper to the flour mixture.
Herb Gravy: Stir chopped fresh herbs into the gravy.
proTips: Keep oil at ~350°F for a crisp coating.
Do not overcrowd the skillet to maintain heat.
